  • No visual regression elsewhere on the website.

Website Optimization & Version Upgrade Prompt for DAGARMY

Optimize and refactor the DAGARMY website for production-level performance, stability, and professional UX, without altering the brand identity, content structure, or visual theme.

  • Remove flashy, exaggerated, or distracting animations

@keyframes fadeInUp {
  from {
    opacity: 0;
    transform: translateY(20px);
  }
  to {
    opacity: 1;
    transform: translateY(0);
  }

#### 2. Intersection Observer (Lightweight JS) 
javascript
// Replace WOW.js with modern Intersection Observer
const observer = new IntersectionObserver((entries) => {
  entries.forEach(entry => {
    if (entry.isIntersecting) {
      entry.target.classList.add('visible');
    }
  });
}, { threshold: 0.1 });
#### 3. Overall Verdict

Critical Issues You Must Fix

1. ❌ Bootstrap Removal Is Correct, But Incomplete

You said:

Remove Bootstrap – Tailwind provides all utility classes needed

Problem:

Fix

    • .container, .row, .col-*

bash

2. ⚠️ WOW.js Replacement Strategy Is Half-Modern

You propose:

  • CSS animation-timeline: view()

  • Intersection Observer fallback

Problem:
animation-timeline: view() is not production-safe yet across all browsers.

Fix (Mandatory)

Use Intersection Observer ONLY. Keep CSS animations simple.

Correct approach:

  • Observer adds a .is-visible class

  • CSS handles animation

css
.reveal {
  opacity: 0;
  transform: translateY(16px);
  transition: opacity 0.6s ease-out, transform 0.6s ease-out;
}

.reveal.is-visible {
  opacity: 1;
  transform: translateY(0);
}

This is boring. That’s good. Boring = stable.

3. ❌ React 19 + Next 16 Reality Ignored

You are using:

  • next@16.1.1

  • react@19.2.3

Your plan does not address the biggest risk.

Problems

  • React 19 introduces stricter rendering behavior

  • Effects can fire more often in dev

  • Bad useEffect usage will surface performance bugs

Fix

Add a hard rule:

❗ No useEffect for animations
❗ No useEffect for layout
❗ No useEffect for data transformation

Use:

  • CSS for animation

  • Server Components for data

  • Props for state flow

4. ⚠️ “Convert Client to Server Components” Is Too Vague

This line is dangerous:

Convert heavy client components to server components

Fix

Be explicit.

Client components ONLY for:

  • Forms

  • Modals

  • Swiper

  • Interactive buttons

  • Auth-related UI

Everything else must be Server Components.

If you don’t enforce this, devs will ignore it.

5. ❌ Bundle Size Target Is Unrealistic

You wrote:

Bundle Size: <200KB (initial JS)

That is not realistic with:

  • Swiper

  • EmailJS
